Authors:
Andy Robert Nilsen, Chris Michael Brown, Tina Claire
Summerfield, David Allan Orlovich
Title:
Cortinarius atropileatus, a new species of agaricoid
Cortinarius from New Zealand.
Abstract:
A new species of agaricoid Cortinarius associated with
Nothofagaceae spp. from New Zealand is described. The new species is
morphologically very similar to C. dulciolens but is distinguished from
that species by having vivid mauve-violet lamellae when young, reduced
verrucose spore ornamentation, a less pronounced plage, and the presence
of abundant clamp connections in the epicuticular hyphae. A molecular
phylogenetic analysis of the internal transcribed spacer (ITS) and RNA
polymerase second largest subunit (RPB2) found that C. atropileatus is
sister to an undescribed sequestrate species, and nested in the section
Dulciolentes with C. dulciolens.
